question: What is the name of the open source project run by the Apache foundation that maps to the HDInsight tools within Azure?
Which of the following would be an example of an Internet of Things (IOT) device?
options: A mobile application that is used to watch online video courses
A web application that people use to perform their banking tasks
A video game, installed on Windows clients around the world, that keep user scores in the cloud
A refrigerator that monitors how much milk you have left and sends you a text message when you are running low
correctAnswer: A refrigerator that monitors how much milk you have left and sends you a text message when you are running low

question: What is the name of Azure's hosted SQL database service?
What is the maximum amount of Azure Storage space a single subscription can store?
What feature of a system makes it elastic?
options: The ability to withstand denial of service attacks
The ability to increase and reduce capacity based on actual demand
The ability to stay up (available) while updates are being made to the system
The ability to heal itself after a crash
correctAnswer: The ability to increase and reduce capacity based on actual demand

question: One of the benefits of the cloud is agility. What does that mean in the context of the cloud?
options: The ability of a system to grow its capacity easily when it reaches full capacity
The ability to recover from a big region-wide failure in a short amount of time
The ability to spin up new resources within minutes
The ability to respond to and drive market change quickly
correctAnswer: The ability to respond to and drive market change quickly

question: Why would someone prefer a consumption-based pricing model as opposed to a time-based pricing model?
options: You can save a lot of money if you don't use the resource often as opposed to having it available for use 24/7
The pricing model is simpler and easier to understand
You can easily predict the cost of the service into the future
It is always cheaper to pay for consumption than to pay by the hour
correctAnswer: You can save a lot of money if you don't use the resource often as opposed to having it available for use 24/7

question: What is the concept of availability?
options: A system must have 100% uptime to be considered available
A system that can scale up and scale down depending on customer demand
A system that has a single point of failure
The percentage of time a system responds properly to requests, expressed as a percentage over time
correctAnswer: The percentage of time a system responds properly to requests, expressed as a percentage over time

question: What is the concept of being able to get your applications and data running in another environment quickly?
How many minutes per month downtime is 99.99% availability?
What is the core problem that you need to solve in order to have a high-availability application?
options: Ensure that your server has a lot of RAM and a lot of CPUs
Have a backup copy of your application on standby, ready to be started up when the main application fails
Ensure the capacity of your server exceeds your highest number of expected concurrent users

question: What two advantages does cloud computing elasticity give to you?
options: You can serve users better during peak traffic periods by automatically adding more capacity
Servers have become a commodity and Microsoft doesn't even need to fix servers that fail within Azure
You can do more regular backups and you won't lose as much when that backup gets restored
correctAnswer: You can serve users better during peak traffic periods by automatically adding more capacity

question: Paying per GB for an unmanaged storage account is an example of what type of cloud pricing model?
_______ allows your private virtual network to access Azure services such as Storage, Cosmos DB, and SQL Database privately, allowing you to disable public access.
What is the best criteria to decide what resources go into the same resource group?
options: Each resource should get its own resource group
All resources of the same type (storage, virtual machines, databases, etc.) go into their own resource group
Resources in a resource group should be related in some way. They should share the same lifecycle so they can be added, updated and deleted together
Only resources from the same region should be in the resource group from that region
correctAnswer: Resources in a resource group should be related in some way. They should share the same lifecycle so they can be added, updated and deleted together

question: On which Azure website are you likely to find the results of penetration tests and security assessments conducted by third-parties regarding Azure?
What is Single Sign-On?
options: The ability to use an existing user ID and password to sign into other applications, and not have to create/memorise a new one
When you sign into an application, it remembers who you are the next time you go there
When an application outsources (federates) its identity service to a third-party platform
correctAnswer: The ability to use an existing user ID and password to sign into other applications, and not have to create/memorise a new one

question: An IT administrator has the requirement to control access to a specific app resource using multi-factor authentication. What Azure service satisfies this requirement?
What is Azure's preferred identity/authentication service?
Which feature of Azure Active Directory will require users to have their mobile phone in order to be able to log in?
Why is a user ID and password sometimes not enough to prove someone is who they say they are?
options: Passwords are usually easy to forget
User ID and password can be used by anyone such as a co-worker, ex-employee, or hacker halfway around the world
Some people might choose the same user ID and password
Passwords must be encrypted before being stored
correctAnswer: User ID and password can be used by anyone such as a co-worker, ex-employee, or hacker halfway around the world

question: What is the goal of a DDoS attack?
options: To crack the password from administrator accounts
To trick users into giving up personal information
To extract data from a database
To overwhelm and exhaust application resources
correctAnswer: To overwhelm and exhaust application resources

question: What service does Azure provide as an optional upgrade to protect against DDoS attacks?
options: Azure protects against DDoS as part of its basic offering and there is no service you can upgrade to

question: In the context of cloud computing, a virtual machine (VM) is primarily associated with which type of cloud hosting model?
Within the landscape of cloud service models, how would Microsoft's Outlook 365 be best categorised?
Why is Azure App Services considered to be Platform as a Service?
options: Azure App Services is not PaaS, it's Software as a Service
You are responsible for keeping the operating system up to date with the latest patches
You can decide on what type of virtual machine it runs: A-series, D-series, or even H-series
You give Azure the code and configuration, and you have no access to the underlying hardware
correctAnswer: You give Azure the code and configuration, and you have no access to the underlying hardware

question: Which Azure storage migration option involves Microsoft shipping you a hard drive for you to copy your files to, after which you ship the hard disk back to them for them to upload to your account?
Where can you go to see all of the international standards compliance documents and audit results that Azure provides for itself?
What services does Azure Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) provide?
Which of the following is the primary benefit of single-sign on (SSO)?
options: Not having to remember an additional user ID and password
correctAnswer: Not having to remember an additional user ID and password

question: Which of the following is an example of passwordless authentication? Choose all that apply.
options: Magic login link sent to your email
Entering a number shown on your phone app
correctAnswer: Magic login link sent to your email
Entering a number shown on your phone app

question: Which feature of Azure AD allows you to restrict access to a resource based on the geographical location of the user?
What is the advantage of 'passwordless authentication' over 'password plus multi-factor authentication'?
How do you invite a person who is not an employee of your company to use one of your applications protected by Azure Active Directory?
options: External Users cannot be managed by Azure Active Directory
Invite them as a Guest User
correctAnswer: Invite them as a Guest User

question: Which of the following is not one of the factors of multi-factor authentication (MFA)?
Which storage access tier is the least expensive to store files per GB?
Which storage access tier is the most expensive to store files per GB?
Which type of Azure storage supports the Server Message Block (SMB) protocol and the Network File System (NFS) protocol for accessing files?
_______ is a command-line utility that you can use to copy blobs or files to or from a storage account.
What is the most common and recommended type of storage account?
What software, using an intuitive interface, can be downloaded for Windows, macOS, or Linux that helps you manage your Azure cloud storage resources from your desktop?
How can you increase the security of a traditional user ID and password system?
options: Use multi-factor authentication which requires an additional device (something you have) to verify
Require users to change their passwords more frequently
Require longer and more complex passwords
Do not allow users to log into an application except using a company registered device
correctAnswer: Use multi-factor authentication which requires an additional device (something you have) to verify
Require users to change their passwords more frequently
Require longer and more complex passwords
Do not allow users to log into an application except using a company registered device

question: Outlook 365 is what type of hosting model?
Azure has the responsibility to manage the hardware in the IaaS model.
A virtual machine is called what type of hosting model?
Which of the following is not an example of Infrastructure as a Service?
Which of the following cloud computing models requires the highest level of involvement in maintaining the operating system and file system by the customer?
Which style of computing is easiest when migrating an existing hosted application from your own data centre into the cloud?
Deploying Azure App Services applications consists of what two components?
Which of the following services would not be considered Infrastructure as a Service?
